competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Administration and Administrative Support
Demonstrate an understanding of the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Research the history of the administration and administrative support career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the administration and administrative support career pathway.
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Education & Training cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Education & Training career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Education & Training career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Education & Training career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Education & Training career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Education & Training career cluster.
Research a career in the Education & Training career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Education & Training career cluster.
Practice health and safety in the learning environment.
Describe the indicators of a healthy child.
Recognize the indicators of childhood illnesses, their causes and preventive measures.
Identify common indicators of child abuse and neglect.
Research laws that relate to reporting suspected child abuse.
List community agencies that provide help to abused children.
Identify safety guidelines to follow when caring for children.
Create a response plan for emergency situations.
Research available certifications for babysitters.
Analyze the nutritional needs of children.
Identify nutritional needs of children.
Research foods that may be harmful to children (i.e. food allergies).
Research long term effects of childhood obesity and poor nutrition.
Plan and prepare nutritious snacks for children using appropriate safety and sanitation procedures.
Exhibit best practices for learning environments.
Arrange learning centers that provide for a child’s exploration, discovery and development.
Develop guidelines for establishing activities, routines and transitions for children.
Utilize technology as it relates to the field of education.
Identify technology utilized in the field of education.
Analyze technology trends impacting education.
Apply technology for efficient operation of the learning environment.
Professional Support Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the professional support services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the professional support services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the professional support services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the professional support services career pathway.
Research the history of the professional support services career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the professional support services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the professional support services career pathway.
Teaching/Training
Demonstrate an understanding of the teaching/training career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the teaching/training career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the teaching/training career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the teaching/training career pathway.
Research the history of the teaching/training career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the teaching/training career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the teaching/training career pathway.
Demonstrate career decisions as they relate to the teaching profession.
Demonstrate employability skills as they relate to teaching.
Identify personal interests, aptitudes, talents and abilities that can contribute to positive self-esteem and success in the work place.
Practice teamwork skills.
Practice positive work ethics and identify negative work ethics, including influences of social media on job performance.
Apply math, reading, science, and critical thinking skills as they relate to the field of education.
Describe and utilize different job search skills.
Develop short-term and long-term goals for personal and professional achievement.
Analyze the physical, emotional, intellectual and social development of children.
Describe common physical, emotional, intellectual and social milestones for children.
Create and demonstrate an age appropriate activity which promotes a child’s growth and development.
Research and demonstrate adaptations appropriate for a special needs child.
Recognize age-appropriate learning activities.
Identify age-appropriate learning activities.
Evaluate games, equipment, activities, books, and play materials for age appropriateness.
Identify and understand basic observation techniques and how they are used to evaluate children’s developmental milestones.
Compare and contrast basic observation techniques in relation to the learning environment.
